author: anacrolix
content:
Brotli is good when you don't want to build a dictionary, and are generating objects that will be read many times. Zstd is better overall. 

Snappy is good when compression speed is more important than everything else. LZ4 absolutely destroys it on every other benchmark.

author: rafa3ls
content: Did the Bootstrap Nodes already implemented protocol versioning support? The enr should change and although is still possible to reach with IP, I am afraid that this may turn these nodes unreachable, I am not sure. It may demand coordination.

author: pipermerriam
content: It seems like bootnodes should be capable of updating without changing node-id/ip/port .. The hard coded ENR records may end up outdated but they should still be usable to bootstrap into the network...  unless there's something I'm missing.

author: rafa3ls
content: Yes, I think so, they can be usable. Bootnodes updated would confirm this.
